Detailed Description

Class to manage command parameters. This class is used to collect string parameters to be passed to an Interp's callback.

int32 uStreamLib::Params::add (  char *  param  ) 
 

Add the specified parameter to this Params table.

Parameters:
param the parameter to add. Notice that the parameter cannot be longer than max_param_size.
Returns:
SUCCESS or FAILURE if param cannot be added.

Definition at line 53 of file interp.cpp.

char* uStreamLib::Params::operator[] (  uint32  index  )  [inline]
 

Use operator [i] to get the parameter at the index i. In a Command callback, you can access the parameters table by using the "p" pointer (first argument). Given the p pointer you can get the parameter at position "i" by using the following syntax: (*p)[i]

Definition at line 70 of file interp.hpp.

Set executing command name. Each command has a parameters table.

Parameters:

Returns:
SUCCESS or FAILURE if command name cannot be set.
